snippet: Google indefinitely delayed shipment of the Nexus Q, its spherical black device for playing music and video, after initial reviews that the device does not do enough. It is central to Google's efforts to compete with Apple and other companies by c...
abstract: Google indefinitely delayed shipment of the Nexus Q, its spherical black device for playing music and video, after initial reviews that the device does not do enough. It is central to Google's efforts to compete with Apple and other companies by connecting home devices to the Internet, starting in the living room.

headline.main: Google Delays the Nexus Q After Poor Reviews

snippet: Introduced for the iPad last year with much fanfare, the publication is letting go almost a third of its full-time staff.
abstract: Introduced for the iPad last year with much fanfare, the publication is letting go almost a third of its full-time staff.

snippet: Facebook’s initial public offering was a massacre for retail investors, highlighting yet again why stock picking is a loser’s game.

snippet: After obtaining licenses from music labels, Amazon can offer more extensive and convenient features on its service, including the ability to scan a user's computer to match songs to a master database.
abstract: After obtaining licenses from music labels, Amazon can offer more extensive and convenient features on its service, including the ability to scan a user's computer to match songs to a master database.

snippet: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration examined the effectiveness of car seat sensors in its campaign to reduce the number of children who die of heatstroke because they have been left in hot cars.

snippet: Julian Robertson, founder of the Tiger Management hedge fund, helped start several careers. Now those managers are helping others begin their own firms.
abstract: Julian Robertson, founder of the Tiger Management hedge fund, helped start several careers; those managers are now helping others begin their own firms, including Richard Gerson; Gerson's new firm, Falcon Edge, raised $1.2 billion, one of the biggest hedge fund start-ups since the financial crisis.

byline.original: By EVELYN M. RUSLI and AZAM AHMED

snippet: Since the implosion of the dot-com bubble in 2000, retail investors have been rightfully wary of the stock market. Facebook was going to change it all, bringing the ordinary investor back.     Instead, Facebook was a massacre for retail investors,...
abstract: Steven M Davidoff Deal Professor column on the disappointing performance of Facebook's stock says it is yet another example of how the average investor consistently loses out whey they buy and trade individual shares of a company. Drawing (M)1
